fashion.translation[0].definitions[0].de: something that is popular or thought to be good at a particular time
fashion.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: His ideas are coming back into fashion (=they are becoming popular again).
Eastern religions used to be the fashion  in the 60s.
Self-help books are all the fashion (=they are very fashionable).
the fashion for ‘discovery methods’ of learning
The emerging science of photography was already changing fashions in art.
Bright colours are in fashion this summer.
Their music will never go out of fashion.
fashion.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a style of clothes, hair etc that is popular at a particular time
fashion.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Young people are very concerned with fashion.
The store has all the latest fashions.
fashion.translation[0].definitions[2].de: the business or study of making and selling clothes, shoes etc in new and changing styles
fashion.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: Belted jackets are in fashion this winter.
Flared trousers were out of fashion in the 1980s.
Long evening dresses are going out of fashion.
Short skirts are coming back into fashion this year.
With her short dress and high boots she was the height of fashion.
Lucy likes to keep up with the latest fashions.
Fashion-conscious people can’t get enough of these new designs.
They sell all the latest fashions.
Men’s fashions have not changed much in 50 years.
London is the centre of the British fashion industry.
Small women are often overlooked by the fashion world.
Calvin Klein’s fashion show featured suits and sportswear.
Fashion models are usually very tall.
Her favourite fashion designers include Giorgio Armani and Gianfranco Ferre.
He went to St Martin’s School of Art to study fashion design.
fashion houses such as Armani and Hugo Boss
She’s the editor of a leading fashion magazine.
a book of Lang’s fashion photography
Later he worked as a fashion photographer for Vogue.
She was asked to star with top model Naomi Campbell in a fashion shoot.
We walked around Milan’s famous fashion shops.
fashion.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: fashion
a style of clothes, hair, behaviour etc that is fashionable. Fashion is also used as an uncountable noun, when talking about all of these styles in general
the latest fashions from Donna Karan
changing fashions in popular music
I’m not interested in fashion.
vogue
if there is a vogue for something, or it is in vogue, it is fashionable. Vogue sounds more formal and typical of the language that more educated speakers use than fashion
the current vogue for realistic animated films
There was a vogue for cream furniture in the 1920s.
His pictures are very much in vogue these days.
trend
a way of doing something or a way of thinking that is becoming fashionable or popular
The magazine focuses on the latest trends in contemporary design.
The trend is for people to wait longer to marry and have children.
craze/fad
a fashion, activity, type of music etc that suddenly becomes very popular, but only remains popular for a short time – often used about things that you think are rather silly
a new fitness craze
the current fad for bare white walls and uncomfortable-looking metal furniture
I’m sure it’s just a passing fad  (=something that will soon stop being fashionable).
fad diets
something is all the rage
used when saying that something is very popular and fashionable for a short time
The game was all the rage at her school.
fashion.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to shape or make something, using your hands or only a few tools
fashion.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: He fashioned a box from a few old pieces of wood.
Jamie could take a piece of wood and fashion it into a wonderful work of art.
fashion.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to influence and form someone’s ideas and opinions
fashion.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: We are all unique human beings, fashioned by life experiences.
fashion.translation[1].definitions[1].no: Fashion is usually passive in this meaning
fashion.translation[2].definitions[0].de: like something, or in the way that a particular group of people does something
fashion.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: They ate Indian-fashion, using their fingers.
fashion.translation[3].definitions[0].de: a way of doing something or behaving that is popular at a particular time
fashion.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Good design will never go out of fashion (=become unfashionable).
Big companies seem to be in fashion (=acceptable and popular) again.
How do you explain the current fashion for takeovers?
fashion.translation[3].definitions[1].de: the business of making and selling clothes, shoes etc in new and changing styles
fashion.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: Emma wants to work in the fashion industry.
fashion.translation[3].definitions[2].de: a style of clothes or hair that is popular at a particular time
fashion.translation[3].definitions[2].ex: We sell only the latest fashions.
Long skirts are back in fashion.  (=are in fashion again after a period of time when they were not)
fashion.translation[4].definitions[0].ex: Houston has fashioned a substantial economic recovery.
The two sides have been unable to fashion a compromise.
